ratings.comment: Professor Senderowicz knows so much and challenges you to think critically, I was really inspired by the material. This class was primarily based on discussion of the readings, which might not be for everyone. She genuinely valued student feedback and ideas. Very accessible out of class– several people would go to her office hours every week.
Professor Senderowicz's class completely changed my mind about global health. She wants every student to learn and to suceed.

The class I took was listed as GenWS 525. AVOID THIS CLASS AT ALL COSTS. This professor has a complete lack of boundaries, respect, and consideration for students. She changed the syllabus halfway through doesnt lecture about the complex papers. Don't even think about missing one discussion or having a different opinion than her. Horrible!!!!
Dr. Senderowics is an amazing professor. Her class was inspiring, captivating, and just all around well done. If you get a chance to take her course, do it!

You have to go to class and do the readings but Leigh is one of the most passionate and knowledgeable professors I've had. She is very flexible and understanding around deadlines and I learned so much from this class. Highly recommend!!
My experience in Prof Leigh's class was amazing. It was challenging and some of the readings were long, but I learned so much and Prof Leigh was always there to help us understand.
This was one of my favorite courses throughout college. Prof Senderowicz is super knowledgeable and cares so much about her students. She was always flexible on extensions whenever I asked

Very reading-heavy class with dense and confusing papers. Kept asking for feedback but never applied any. Kept saying that she's from Harvard and since UW is a "big ten" school she has high expectations from everyone. Just said "College is supposed to be hard" when most of her students were struggling and begged for leniency. Harsh grader too.

SO much reading. Would always say it was a "manageable week" of reading, then assign us 100+ pages a week. Constantly felt pressured to participate even when I didn't have anything to contribute because you are graded on your engagement every class. You could feel that she felt above everyone, and would make you feel dumb.

While passionate and knowledgeable about the topic, she expects everyone else to be equally knowledgeable. There are no lectures, just 75 min. discussions that don't benefit your learning. She requests feedback repeatedly throughout the semester, yet becomes defensive and ignores said feedback if it doesn't align with what she wants to hear. Avoid.

Dense readings that were often very distant from global health issues, despite that being the topic of the class. I have loved every single other GWS class I've taken at UW, but absolutely hated this class. Prof. Senderowicz did not create an environment conducive for discussion and graded way more harshly than other professors in the department.

I have had some bad professors but never has a professor driven me to Rate My Professor. She is so passive aggressive towards students and tries to humiliate students in front of the whole class. There is so much busy work. She only teaches one side of the story and refuses to acknowledge that there even exists alternative view points.

There's lots of reading in this class and you have to work but Leigh was also super flexible and gave me extensions when I needed one. The feedback I got was really helpful and helped me improve my writing a ton.

Topics were interesting but readings were long and dense. I disliked the structure of this course because we had to grade ourselves for participation after each class and got downgraded if we didn't speak once in a class of 40 people. Doesn't give clear guidelines on writing assignments. Doesn't listen to student feedback.

Obviously, it is only midsemester, so I can't give a full scope of a review. I think the other reviews on here seem harsh. She has graded everything of mine very generously and is kind and approachable in our class. Lots of reading and discussion, mostly graded by 2 papers, a project, and attendance. Make sure you have one thing to say each day

As a GWS Major, I have never felt so uncomfortable & undermined in a classroom before. I was taken aback by how passive aggressive, confrontational & dismissive this prof was during a simple discussion about a graded assignment. I also don't feel these topics are taught or theorized in a way that is super novel or engaging. The energy is just bad.

Great professor, often ~100 pages of reading -ish per week but we discuss and unpack it in lecture. While the course requires a lot of busy-work (self-graded participation and reading questions every class), the material is interesting and you can tell how passionate and knowledgeable she is about the topic!
